root_causes: Missing validation enforcing MultiItemsSelectedMinimum = 1 (no check that at least one sub-item is selected).
Missing CheckDK3D('A4x2','A4DKx2') logic â€” no DK/conflict validation present for the DK special-code variable.
Missing OpenText validations: the script does not implement CheckMultiOpenD1() nor CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(...) that should run when the multi question is answered.
The generated script only checks each subvariable for allowed codes (0,1,97,98,99) but does not implement the additional validation/business rules defined in question_attributes.
instructions: Add a validation that flags respondents when none of the subquestions A4x2_1..A4x2_5 is selected (i.e. no value equals the 'selected' code, typically 1). Example approach: flag where all of A4x2_1..A4x2_5 are not equal to 1 (and not a valid special code) when the question is in-scope.

Implement the CheckDK3D('A4x2','A4DKx2') rule: ensure that if the dedicated DK/other indicator variable (A4DKx2) is set (DK/Ref code) then no other items are selected, and vice versa. Add explicit SPSS checks that list cases violating that rule.

Implement the open-text validations that run when the multi question has any selection (the expected logic: if f('A4x2').toBoolean() then CheckMultiOpenD1(); CheckOpenLengthMultiOE(CurrentForm(),5,0,"chars")). Concretely, add checks for any associated open-text field(s) (e.g. A4x2_other or the multi OE fields): enforce required open-text behaviour and enforce minimum/maximum length (as per CheckOpenLengthMultiOE parameters).

Combine the code validation already present with the additional business rules above so the SPSS script both flags invalid codes AND flags missing selections, DK conflicts, and open-text length/presence violations.

If specific special-code values or an 'A4DKx2' variable name differ in your dataset, use the actual variable and code values in the SPSS checks. For example, to check minimum selections you can add a TEMPORARY / SELECT IF block or a COMPUTE/IF to create a flag variable where SUM(A4x2_1 = 1, ..., A4x2_5 = 1) = 0 and then LIST those cases.
